repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: This will remove unrelated errors in .nvimlog at the end of test output.

comment_data.body: Can this be `ILOG` ? Why would we want to ignore this error?
This is definitely an improvement, thanks. Eventually, do we still want to fix this at a lower level? I.e. if this error truly doesn't matter then we shouldn't log it (for specific cases on Windows).

ðŸ‘  NVIM_APPNAME does not affect server name on Windows.

We could instead assert the message is _not_ found (`assert_nolog`) on Windows.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -928,6 +932,9 @@ describe('stdpath()', function()
     -- Valid appnames:
     test_appname('a/b', 0)
     test_appname('a/b\\c', 0)
+    if not is_os('win') then
+      assert_log('Failed to start server: no such file or directory:', testlog)

comment_data.body: Could be a bug (or at least a risk). But at least now it's "documented" in our tests.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3120,6 +3127,9 @@ describe('TUI as a client', function()
 
     client_super:close()
     server:close()
+    if is_os('mac') then
+      assert_log('uv_tty_set_mode failed: Unknown system error %-102', testlog)

comment_data.body: Uhh, isn't that the same thing? Maybe the intent is clearer you mean?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -928,6 +932,9 @@ describe('stdpath()', function()
     -- Valid appnames:
     test_appname('a/b', 0)
     test_appname('a/b\\c', 0)
+    if not is_os('win') then
+      assert_log('Failed to start server: no such file or directory:', testlog)

comment_data.body:
yes, by "instead" I meant we could change the test code (not the behavior).

```
if is_os('win') then
  assert_nolog(...)
else
  assert_log('Failed to start server: no such file or directory:', testlog)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -928,6 +932,9 @@ describe('stdpath()', function()
     -- Valid appnames:
     test_appname('a/b', 0)
     test_appname('a/b\\c', 0)
+    if not is_os('win') then
+      assert_log('Failed to start server: no such file or directory:', testlog)

comment_data.body: Hmm, what makes this specific error different compared to the other errors we "ignore" with `assert_log`. Aka, what makes this particular error different?

comment_regular_data.body: These changes look quite arbitrary. What is the definition of "expected errors"?

> What is the definition of "expected errors"?

Errors that are intentional/expected in the tests. To resolve this, tests should define a local NVIM_LOG_FILE and use `assert_log` to check that the expected messages were logged.

Changing `ELOG` to `ILOG` isn't generally the right way to fix this, unless a particular message truly isn't considered an error.

> To resolve this, tests should define a local NVIM_LOG_FILE and use `assert_log` to check that the expected messages were logged.

Yeah, I'm working on it. That's what I did but some problems showed up so it's still work in progress.
 
> Changing `ELOG` to `ILOG` isn't generally the right way to fix this, unless a particular message truly isn't considered an error.

The problem with these specific logs was that we're already testing the error output. That and some tests straight up fail if we change the log file.

Thanks for this. Now should we _fail_ CI if the logs are _not_ empty?

P.S. before/after examples are helpful for this kind of change (though the "after" in this case is "empty"). 

before:

```
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
$NVIM_LOG_FILE: /Users/runner/work/neovim/neovim/build/.nvimlog
(last 100 lines)
ERR 2024-03-28T21:59:26.081 nvim.14952.0 chan_close_with_error:560: RPC: failed to decode msgpack
ERR 2024-03-28T21:59:26.082 nvim.14952.0 chan_close_with_error:560: RPC: (null)
ERR 2024-03-28T21:59:27.057 T1409.15103.0 libuv_process_spawn:93: uv_spawn(/bin/pwd) failed: permission denied
ERR 2024-03-28T21:59:32.183 T1451.16112.0 libuv_process_spawn:93: uv_spawn(nosuchshell) failed: no such file or directory
ERR 2024-03-28T21:59:32.184 T1451.16112.0 libuv_process_spawn:93: uv_spawn(nosuchshell) failed: no such file or directory
ERR 2024-03-28T21:59:35.382 T1517.16548.0/c os_set_cloexec:493: Failed to get flags on descriptor 3: Bad file descriptor
WRN 2024-03-28T22:01:07.537 T3802.20024.0/c server_start:163: Failed to start server: no such file or directory: /Users/runner/work/neovim/neovim/build/Xtest_tmpdir/a%b.runner/rGXrSF/a/
WRN 2024-03-28T22:01:07.547 T3802.20024.0/c server_start:163: Failed to start server: no such file or directory: /Users/runner/work/neovim/neovim/build/Xtest_tmpdir/a%b%c.runner/GQgM6J/a/
ERR 2024-03-28T22:02:23.005 nvim.23439.0 tui_mode_change:1284: uv_tty_set_mode failed: Unknown system error -102
ERR 2024-03-28T22:02:34.372 T5248.23805.0 decor_provider_error:38: error in provider ns1.start: Error executing lua: [string "<nvim>"]:4: Foo
stack traceback:
	[C]: in function 'error'
	[string "<nvim>"]:4: in function <[string "<nvim>"]:3>
ERR 2024-03-28T22:02:34.372 T5248.23805.0 decor_provider_error:38: error in provider ns1.end: Error executing lua: [string "<nvim>"]:4: Foo
stack traceback:
	[C]: in function 'error'
	[string "<nvim>"]:4: in function <[string "<nvim>"]:3>
ERR 2024-03-28T22:02:44.192 T5422.24446.0 os_set_cloexec:493: Failed to get flags on descriptor 3: Bad file descriptor
ERR 2024-03-28T22:03:58.598 T7038.27015.0 libuv_process_spawn:93: uv_spawn(fake_shell) failed: no such file or directory
```

> Thanks for this. Now should we fail CI if the logs are not empty?

Yes, I'd hate to see an accidental regression in this. Continued in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/28323 where I address some of the suggestions raised here.

title: test: silence expected errors
